verses.verse: (Cross references: : Eccl. 7:1) A good name is to be chosen above great riches, and (Which cometh by well doing.) loving favor is above silver and above gold.
(Prov. 29:13) The rich and poor (Live together, and have need the one of the other.) meet together, the Lord is the maker of them all.

(Prov. 27:12) A prudent man (That is, the punishment, which is prepared for the wicked, and fleeth [not to] God for succor.) seeth the plague, and hideth himself: but the foolish go on still, and are punished.
The reward of humility, and the fear of God is riches, and glory, and life.
Thorns and snares are in the way of the froward: but he that regardeth his soul, will depart far from them.
Teach a child (Bring him up virtuously, and he shall so continue.) in the trade of his way, and when he is old he shall not depart from it.
The rich ruleth the poor, and the borrower is servant to the man that lendeth.
He that soweth iniquity, shall reap affliction, and the (His authority, whereby he did oppress others, shall be taken from him.) rod of his anger shall fail.
He that hath a good (He that is merciful and liberal.) eye, he shall be blessed: for he giveth of his bread unto the poor.
Cast out the scorner, and strife shall go out: so contention and reproach shall cease.

He that loveth pureness of heart for the grace of his lips, the (He showeth that princes should use their familiarity, whose conscience is good, and their talk wise and godly.) king shall be his friend.
The eyes of the Lord preserve (Favor them that love knowledge.) knowledge: but he overthroweth the words of the transgressor.
The slothful man saith, (He derideth them that invent vain excuses, because they would not do their duty.) A lion is without, I shall be slain in the street.

The mouth of strange women is as a deep pit: he with whom the Lord is angry, (So God punisheth one sin by another, when he suffereth the wicked to fall into the acquaintance of an harlot.) shall fall therein.
Foolishness is bound (He is naturally given unto it.) in the heart of a child: but the rod of correction shall drive it away from him.
He that oppresseth the poor to increase himself, and giveth unto the rich, shall surely come to poverty.
Â¶ Incline thine ear, and hear the words of the wise, and apply thine heart unto my knowledge.
For it shall be pleasant, if thou keep them in thy belly, and if they be directed together in thy lips.
That thy confidence may be in (He showeth what the end of wisdom is: to wit, to direct us to the Lord.) the Lord, I have showed thee this day: thou therefore take heed.
Have not I written unto thee (That is, sundry times.) three times in counsels and knowledge,
That I might show thee the assurance of the words of truth, to answer the words of truth to them that send to thee?
Rob not the poor, because he is poor, neither oppress the afflicted (Hebrew, in the gates.) in judgment.
For the Lord (Prov. 23:11) will defend their cause, and spoil the soul of those that spoil them.
Make (Have not to do with him that is not able to rule his affections: for he would hurt thee by his evil conversation.) no friendship with an angry man, neither go with the furious man,
Lest thou learn his ways, and receive destruction to thy soul.
Be not thou of them that (Which rashly put themselves in danger for others, as Prov. 6:2.) tough the hand, nor among them that are surety for debts.
If thou hast nothing to pay, why causest thou that he should take thy bed from under thee?
Thou shalt not (Deut. 17:17; Prov. 23:10) remove the ancient bounds which thy fathers have made.
Thou seest that a diligent man in his business standeth before Kings, and standeth not before the base sort.
